t: 1 Chronicles 1
Adam,*p Seth, Enosh,
Kenan,*p Mahalaleel, Jared,
Enoch,*p Methuselah, Lamech,
Noah,*p Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
The*p sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.
And*p the sons of Gomer; Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.
And*p the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
The*p sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
And*p the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabtecha. And the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.
And*p Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be mighty upon the earth.
And*p Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,
And*p Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (of whom came the Philistines,) and Caphtorim.
And*p Canaan begat Zidon his firstborn, and Heth,
The*p Jebusite also, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,
And*p the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,
And*p the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.
The*p sons of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech.
And*p Arphaxad begat Shelah, and Shelah begat Eber.
And*p unto Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg; because in his days the earth was divided: and his brother's name was Joktan.
And*p Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
Hadoram*p also, and Uzal, and Diklah,
And*p Ebal, and Abimael, and Sheba,
And*p Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
Shem,*p Arphaxad, Shelah,
Eber,*p Peleg, Reu,
Serug,*p Nahor, Terah,
Abram;*p the same is Abraham.
The*p sons of Abraham; Isaac, and Ishmael.
These*p are their generations: The firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,
Mishma,*p and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,
Jetur,*p Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.
Now*p the sons of Keturah, Abraham's concubine: she bare Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan; Sheba, and Dedan.
And*p the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these are the sons of Keturah.
And*p Abraham begat Isaac. The sons of Isaac; Esau and Israel.
The*p sons of Esau; Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.
The*p sons of Eliphaz; Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.
The*p sons of Reuel; Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
And*p the sons of Seir; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah, and Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan.
And*p the sons of Lotan; Hori, and Homam: and Timna was Lotan's sister.
The*p sons of Shobal; Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon; Aiah, and Anah.
The*p sons of Anah; Dishon. And the sons of Dishon; Amram, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.
The*p sons of Ezer; Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Jakan. The sons of Dishan; Uz, and Aran.
Now*p these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the children of Israel; Bela the son of Beor: and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
And*p when Bela was dead, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.
And*p when Jobab was dead, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.
And*p when Husham was dead, Hadad the son of Bedad, which smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Avith.
And*p when Hadad was dead, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
And*p when Samlah was dead, Shaul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.
And*p when Shaul was dead, Baal–hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.
And*p when Baal–hanan was dead, Hadad reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Pau; and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
Hadad*p died also. And the dukes of Edom were; duke Timnah, duke Alvah, duke Jetheth,
Duke*p Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,
Duke*p Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,
Duke*p Magdiel, duke Iram. These are the dukes of Edom.
1 Chronicles 2
These*p are the sons of Israel; Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,
Dan,*p Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

The*p sons of Judah; Er, and Onan, and Shelah: which three were born unto him of the daughter of Shua the Canaanitess. And Er, the firstborn of Judah, was evil in the sight of the Lord;*s and he slew him.
And*p Tamar his daughter in law bare him Pharez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.
The*p sons of Pharez; Hezron, and Hamul.
And*p the sons of Zerah; Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol, and Dara: five of them in all.
And*p the sons of Carmi; Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed in the thing accursed.
And*p the sons of Ethan; Azariah.
The*p sons also of Hezron, that were born unto him; Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai.
And*p Ram begat Amminadab; and Amminadab begat Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;
And*p Nahshon begat Salma, and Salma begat Boaz,
And*p Boaz begat Obed, and Obed begat Jesse,
And*p Jesse begat his firstborn Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimma the third,
Nethaneel*p the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
Ozem*p the sixth, David the seventh:
Whose*p sisters were Zeruiah, and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah; Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.
And*p Abigail bare Amasa: and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
And*p Caleb the son of Hezron begat children of Azubah his wife, and of Jerioth: her sons are these; Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.
And*p when Azubah was dead, Caleb took unto him Ephrath, which bare him Hur.
And*p Hur begat Uri, and Uri begat Bezaleel.
And*p afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he married when he was threescore years old; and she bare him Segub.
And*p Segub begat Jair, who had three and twenty cities in the land of Gilead.
And*p he took Geshur, and Aram, with the towns of Jair, from them, with Kenath, and the towns thereof, even threescore cities. All these belonged to the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.
And*p after that Hezron was dead in Caleb–ephratah, then Abiah Hezron's wife bare him Ashur the father of Tekoa.
And*p the sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were, Ram the firstborn, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, and Ahijah.
Jerahmeel*p had also another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
And*p the sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel were, Maaz, and Jamin, and Eker.
And*p the sons of Onam were, Shammai, and Jada. And the sons of Shammai; Nadab, and Abishur.
And*p the name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail, and she bare him Ahban, and Molid.
And*p the sons of Nadab; Seled, and Appaim: but Seled died without children.
And*p the sons of Appaim; Ishi. And the sons of Ishi; Sheshan. And the children of Sheshan; Ahlai.
And*p the sons of Jada the brother of Shammai; Jether, and Jonathan: and Jether died without children.
And*p the sons of Jonathan; Peleth, and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
Now*p Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. And Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.
And*p Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant to wife; and she bare him Attai.
And*p Attai begat Nathan, and Nathan begat Zabad,
And*p Zabad begat Ephlal, and Ephlal begat Obed,
And*p Obed begat Jehu, and Jehu begat Azariah,
And*p Azariah begat Helez, and Helez begat Eleasah,
And*p Eleasah begat Sisamai, and Sisamai begat Shallum,
And*p Shallum begat Jekamiah, and Jekamiah begat Elishama.
Now*p the sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were, Mesha his firstborn, which was the father of Ziph; and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.
And*p the sons of Hebron; Korah, and Tappuah, and Rekem, and Shema.
And*p Shema begat Raham, the father of Jorkoam: and Rekem begat Shammai.
And*p the son of Shammai was Maon: and Maon was the father of Beth–zur.
And*p Ephah, Caleb's concubine, bare Haran, and Moza, and Gazez: and Haran begat Gazez.
And*p the sons of Jahdai; Regem, and Jotham, and Geshan, and Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.
Maachah,*p Caleb's concubine, bare Sheber, and Tirhanah.
She*p bare also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbenah, and the father of Gibea: and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
These*p were the sons of Caleb the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephratah; Shobal the father of Kirjath–jearim,
Salma*p the father of Beth–lehem, Hareph the father of Beth–gader.
And*p Shobal the father of Kirjath–jearim had sons; Haroeh, and half of the Manahethites.
And*p the families of Kirjath–jearim; the Ithrites, and the Puhites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them came the Zorathites, and the Eshtaulites.
The*p sons of Salma; Beth–lehem, and the Netophathites, Ataroth, the house of Joab, and half of the Manahethites, the Zorites.
And*p the families of the scribes which dwelt at Jabez; the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and Suchathites. These are the Kenites that came of Hemath, the father of the house of Rechab.
1 Chronicles 3
Now*p these were the sons of David, which were born unto him in Hebron; the firstborn Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second Daniel, of Abigail the Carmelitess:
The*p third, Absalom the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur: the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith:
The*p fifth, Shephatiah of Abital: the sixth, Ithream by Eglah his wife.
These*p six were born unto him in Hebron; and there he reigned seven years and six months: and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three years.
And*p these were born unto him in Jerusalem; Shimea, and Shobab, and Nathan, and Solomon, four, of Bath–shua the daughter of Ammiel:
Ibhar*p also, and Elishama, and Eliphelet,
And*p Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
And*p Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.
These*p were all the sons of David, beside the sons of the concubines, and Tamar their sister.
And*p Solomon's son was Rehoboam, Abia his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
Joram*p his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
Amaziah*p his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,
Ahaz*p his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
Amon*p his son, Josiah his son.
And*p the sons of Josiah were, the firstborn Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.
And*p the sons of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his son.
And*p the sons of Jeconiah; Assir, Salathiel his son,
Malchiram*p also, and Pedaiah, and Shenazar, Jecamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
And*p the sons of Pedaiah were, Zerubbabel, and Shimei: and the sons of Zerubbabel; Meshullam, and Hananiah, and Shelomith their sister:
And*p Hashubah, and Ohel, and Berechiah, and Hasadiah, Jushab–hesed, five.
And*p the sons of Hananiah; Pelatiah, and Jesaiah: the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shechaniah.
And*p the sons of Shechaniah; Shemaiah: and the sons of Shemaiah; Hattush, and Igeal, and Bariah, and Neariah, and Shaphat, six.
And*p the sons of Neariah; Elioenai, and Hezekiah, and Azrikam, three.
And*p the sons of Elioenai were, Hodaiah, and Eliashib, and Pelaiah, and Akkub, and Johanan, and Dalaiah, and Anani, seven.
1 Chronicles 4
The*p sons of Judah; Pharez, Hezron, and Carmi, and Hur, and Shobal.
And*p Reaiah the son of Shobal begat Jahath; and Jahath begat Ahumai, and Lahad. These are the families of the Zorathites.
And*p these were of the father of Etam; Jezreel, and Ishma, and Idbash: and the name of their sister was Hazelelponi:
And*p Penuel the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephratah, the father of Beth–lehem.
And*p Ashur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
And*p Naarah bare him Ahuzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
And*p the sons of Helah were, Zereth, and Jezoar, and Ethnan.
And*p Coz begat Anub, and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.
And*p Jabez was more honourable than his brethren: and his mother called his name Jabez, saying, Because I bare him with sorrow.

And*p Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, Oh that thou wouldest bless me indeed, and enlarge my coast, and that thine hand might be with me, and that thou wouldest keep me from evil, that it may not grieve me! And God granted him that which he requested.
And*p Chelub the brother of Shuah begat Mehir, which was the father of Eshton.
And*p Eshton begat Beth–rapha, and Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir–nahash. These are the men of Rechah.
And*p the sons of Kenaz; Othniel, and Seraiah: and the sons of Othniel; Hathath.
And*p Meonothai begat Ophrah: and Seraiah begat Joab, the father of the valley of Charashim; for they were craftsmen.
And*p the sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh; Iru, Elah, and Naam: and the sons of Elah, even Kenaz.
And*p the sons of Jehaleleel; Ziph, and Ziphah, Tiria, and Asareel.
And*p the sons of Ezra were, Jether, and Mered, and Epher, and Jalon: and she bare Miriam, and Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
And*p his wife Jehudijah bare Jered the father of Gedor, and Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. And these are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, which Mered took.
And*p the sons of his wife Hodiah the sister of Naham, the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maachathite.
And*p the sons of Shimon were, Amnon, and Rinnah, Ben–hanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were, Zoheth, and Ben–zoheth.
The*p sons of Shelah the son of Judah were, Er the father of Lecah, and Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of them that wrought fine linen, of the house of Ashbea,
And*p Jokim, and the men of Chozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who had the dominion in Moab, and Jashubi–lehem. And these are ancient things.
These*p were the potters, and those that dwelt among plants and hedges: there they dwelt with the king for his work.
The*p sons of Simeon were, Nemuel, and Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul:
Shallum*p his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.
And*p the sons of Mishma; Hamuel his son, Zacchur his son, Shimei his son.
And*p Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brethren had not many children, neither did all their family multiply, like to the children of Judah.
And*p they dwelt at Beer–sheba, and Moladah, and Hazar–shual,
And*p at Bilhah, and at Ezem, and at Tolad,
And*p at Bethuel, and at Hormah, and at Ziklag,
And*p at Beth–marcaboth, and Hazar–susim, and at Beth–biri, and at Shaaraim. These were their cities unto the reign of David.
And*p their villages were, Etam, and Ain, Rimmon, and Tochen, and Ashan, five cities:
And*p all their villages that were round about the same cities, unto Baal. These were their habitations, and their genealogy.
And*p Meshobab, and Jamlech, and Joshah the son of Amaziah,
And*p Joel, and Jehu the son of Josibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
And*p Elioenai, and Jaakobah, and Jeshohaiah, and Asaiah, and Adiel, and Jesimiel, and Benaiah,
And*p Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah;
These*p mentioned by their names were princes in their families: and the house of their fathers increased greatly.
And*p they went to the entrance of Gedor, even unto the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.
And*p they found fat pasture and good, and the land was wide, and quiet, and peaceable; for they of Ham had dwelt there of old.

And*p these written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and smote their tents, and the habitations that were found there, and destroyed them utterly unto this day, and dwelt in their rooms: because there was pasture there for their flocks.
And*p some of them, even of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah, and Neariah, and Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.
And*p they smote the rest of the Amalekites that were escaped, and dwelt there unto this day.
1 Chronicles 5

Now*p the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel, (for he was the firstborn; but, forasmuch as he defiled his father's bed, his birthright was given unto the sons of Joseph the son of Israel: and the genealogy is not to be reckoned after the birthright.
For*p Judah prevailed above his brethren, and of him came the chief ruler; but the birthright was Joseph's:)
The*p sons, I say, of Reuben the firstborn of Israel were, Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
The*p sons of Joel; Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
Micah*p his son, Reaia his son, Baal his son,
Beerah*p his son, whom Tilgath–pilneser king of Assyria carried away captive: he was prince of the Reubenites.
And*p his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned, were the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,
And*p Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who dwelt in Aroer, even unto Nebo and Baal–meon:
And*p eastward he inhabited unto the entering in of the wilderness from the river Euphrates: because their cattle were multiplied in the land of Gilead.
And*p in the days of Saul they made war with the Hagarites, who fell by their hand: and they dwelt in their tents throughout all the east land of Gilead.
And*p the children of Gad dwelt over against them, in the land of Bashan unto Salecah:
Joel*p the chief, and Shapham the next, and Jaanai, and Shaphat in Bashan.
And*p their brethren of the house of their fathers were, Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jachan, and Zia, and Heber, seven.
These*p are the children of Abihail the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;
Ahi*p the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of the house of their fathers.
And*p they dwelt in Gilead in Bashan, and in her towns, and in all the suburbs of Sharon, upon their borders.
All*p these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.

The*p sons of Reuben, and the Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh, of valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword, and to shoot with bow, and skilful in war, were four and forty thousand seven hundred and threescore, that went out to the war.
And*p they made war with the Hagarites, with Jetur, and Naphish, and Nodab.

And*p they were helped against them, and the Hagarites were delivered into their hand, and all that were with them: for they cried to God in the battle, and he was entreated of them; because they put their trust in him.
And*p they took away their cattle; of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred and fifty thousand, and of asses two thousand, and of men an hundred thousand.
For*p there fell down many slain, because the war was of God. And they dwelt in their steads until the captivity.
And*p the children of the half tribe of Manasseh dwelt in the land: they increased from Bashan unto Baal–hermon and Senir, and unto mount Hermon.

And*p these were the heads of the house of their fathers, even Epher, and Ishi, and Eliel, and Azriel, and Jeremiah, and Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, mighty men of valour, famous men, and heads of the house of their fathers.
And*p they transgressed against the God of their fathers, and went a whoring after the gods of the people of the land, whom God destroyed before them.

And*p the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgath–pilneser king of Assyria, and he carried them away, even the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, and brought them unto Halah, and Habor, and Hara, and to the river Gozan, unto this day.
1 Chronicles 6
The*p sons of Levi; Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
And*p the sons of Kohath; Amram, Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.
And*p the children of Amram; Aaron, and Moses, and Miriam. The sons also of Aaron; Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
Eleazar*p begat Phinehas, Phinehas begat Abishua,
And*p Abishua begat Bukki, and Bukki begat Uzzi,
And*p Uzzi begat Zerahiah, and Zerahiah begat Meraioth,
Meraioth*p begat Amariah, and Amariah begat Ahitub,
And*p Ahitub begat Zadok, and Zadok begat Ahimaaz,
And*p Ahimaaz begat Azariah, and Azariah begat Johanan,
And*p Johanan begat Azariah, (he it is that executed the priest's office in the temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem:)
And*p Azariah begat Amariah, and Amariah begat Ahitub,
And*p Ahitub begat Zadok, and Zadok begat Shallum,
And*p Shallum begat Hilkiah, and Hilkiah begat Azariah,
And*p Azariah begat Seraiah, and Seraiah begat Jehozadak,
And*p Jehozadak went into captivity, when the Lord*s carried away Judah and Jerusalem by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
The*p sons of Levi; Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
And*p these be the names of the sons of Gershom; Libni, and Shimei.
And*p the sons of Kohath were, Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.
The*p sons of Merari; Mahli, and Mushi. And these are the families of the Levites according to their fathers.
Of*p Gershom; Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
Joah*p his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, Jeaterai his son.
The*p sons of Kohath; Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
Elkanah*p his son, and Ebiasaph his son, and Assir his son,
Tahath*p his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.
And*p the sons of Elkanah; Amasai, and Ahimoth.
As*p for Elkanah: the sons of Elkanah; Zophai his son, and Nahath his son,
Eliab*p his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son.
And*p the sons of Samuel; the firstborn Vashni, and Abiah.
The*p sons of Merari; Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzza his son,
Shimea*p his son, Haggiah his son, Asaiah his son.
And*p these are they whom David set over the service of song in the house of the Lord,*s after that the ark had rest.

And*p they ministered before the dwelling place of the tabernacle of the congregation with singing, until Solomon had built the house of the Lord*s in Jerusalem: and then they waited on their office according to their order.
And*p these are they that waited with their children. Of the sons of the Kohathites: Heman a singer, the son of Joel, the son of Shemuel,
The*p son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
The*p son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
The*p son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
The*p son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
The*p son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
And*p his brother Asaph, who stood on his right hand, even Asaph the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,
The*p son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchiah,
The*p son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
The*p son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
The*p son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.
And*p their brethren the sons of Merari stood on the left hand: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,
The*p son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
The*p son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shamer,
The*p son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
Their*p brethren also the Levites were appointed unto all manner of service of the tabernacle of the house of God.

But*p Aaron and his sons offered upon the altar of the burnt offering, and on the altar of incense, and were appointed for all the work of the place most holy, and to make an atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
And*p these are the sons of Aaron; Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
Bukki*p his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
Meraioth*p his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
Zadok*p his son, Ahimaaz his son.
Now*p these are their dwelling places throughout their castles in their coasts, of the sons of Aaron, of the families of the Kohathites: for theirs was the lot.
And*p they gave them Hebron in the land of Judah, and the suburbs thereof round about it.
But*p the fields of the city, and the villages thereof, they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
And*p to the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of Judah, namely, Hebron, the city of refuge, and Libnah with her suburbs, and Jattir, and Eshtemoa, with their suburbs,
And*p Hilen with her suburbs, Debir with her suburbs,
And*p Ashan with her suburbs, and Beth–shemesh with her suburbs:
And*p out of the tribe of Benjamin; Geba with her suburbs, and Alemeth with her suburbs, and Anathoth with her suburbs. All their cities throughout their families were thirteen cities.
And*p unto the sons of Kohath, which were left of the family of that tribe, were cities given out of the half tribe, namely, out of the half tribe of Manasseh, by lot, ten cities.

And*p to the sons of Gershom throughout their families out of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, and out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.
Unto*p the sons of Merari were given by lot, throughout their families, out of the tribe of Reuben, and out of the tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.
And*p the children of Israel gave to the Levites these cities with their suburbs.

And*p they gave by lot out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, and out of the tribe of the children of Benjamin, these cities, which are called by their names.
And*p the residue of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their coasts out of the tribe of Ephraim.
And*p they gave unto them, of the cities of refuge, Shechem in mount Ephraim with her suburbs; they gave also Gezer with her suburbs,
And*p Jokmeam with her suburbs, and Beth–horon with her suburbs,
And*p Aijalon with her suburbs, and Gath–rimmon with her suburbs:
And*p out of the half tribe of Manasseh; Aner with her suburbs, and Bileam with her suburbs, for the family of the remnant of the sons of Kohath.
Unto*p the sons of Gershom were given out of the family of the half tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan with her suburbs, and Ashtaroth with her suburbs:
And*p out of the tribe of Issachar; Kedesh with her suburbs, Daberath with her suburbs,
And*p Ramoth with her suburbs, and Anem with her suburbs:
And*p out of the tribe of Asher; Mashal with her suburbs, and Abdon with her suburbs,
And*p Hukok with her suburbs, and Rehob with her suburbs:
And*p out of the tribe of Naphtali; Kedesh in Galilee with her suburbs, and Hammon with her suburbs, and Kirjathaim with her suburbs.
Unto*p the rest of the children of Merari were given out of the tribe of Zebulun, Rimmon with her suburbs, Tabor with her suburbs:
And*p on the other side Jordan by Jericho, on the east side of Jordan, were given them out of the tribe of Reuben, Bezer in the wilderness with her suburbs, and Jahzah with her suburbs,
Kedemoth*p also with her suburbs, and Mephaath with her suburbs:
And*p out of the tribe of Gad; Ramoth in Gilead with her suburbs, and Mahanaim with her suburbs,
And*p Heshbon with her suburbs, and Jazer with her suburbs.
1 Chronicles 7
Now*p the sons of Issachar were, Tola, and Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four.

And*p the sons of Tola; Uzzi, and Rephaiah, and Jeriel, and Jahmai, and Jibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their father's house, to wit, of Tola: they were valiant men of might in their generations; whose number was in the days of David two and twenty thousand and six hundred.
And*p the sons of Uzzi; Izrahiah: and the sons of Izrahiah; Michael, and Obadiah, and Joel, Ishiah, five: all of them chief men.
And*p with them, by their generations, after the house of their fathers, were bands of soldiers for war, six and thirty thousand men: for they had many wives and sons.
And*p their brethren among all the families of Issachar were valiant men of might, reckoned in all by their genealogies fourscore and seven thousand.
The*p sons of Benjamin; Bela, and Becher, and Jediael, three.

And*p the sons of Bela; Ezbon, and Uzzi, and Uzziel, and Jerimoth, and Iri, five; heads of the house of their fathers, mighty men of valour; and were reckoned by their genealogies twenty and two thousand and thirty and four.
And*p the sons of Becher; Zemira, and Joash, and Eliezer, and Elioenai, and Omri, and Jerimoth, and Abiah, and Anathoth, and Alameth. All these are the sons of Becher.
And*p the number of them, after their genealogy by their generations, heads of the house of their fathers, mighty men of valour, was twenty thousand and two hundred.
The*p sons also of Jediael; Bilhan: and the sons of Bilhan; Jeush, and Benjamin, and Ehud, and Chenaanah, and Zethan, and Tharshish, and Ahishahar.
All*p these the sons of Jediael, by the heads of their fathers, mighty men of valour, were seventeen thousand and two hundred soldiers, fit to go out for war and battle.
Shuppim*p also, and Huppim, the children of Ir, and Hushim, the sons of Aher.
The*p sons of Naphtali; Jahziel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.
The*p sons of Manasseh; Asriel, whom she bare: (but his concubine the Aramitess bare Machir the father of Gilead:
And*p Machir took to wife the sister of Huppim and Shuppim, whose sister's name was Maachah;) and the name of the second was Zelophehad: and Zelophehad had daughters.
And*p Maachah the wife of Machir bare a son, and she called his name Peresh; and the name of his brother was Sheresh; and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
And*p the sons of Ulam; Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
And*p his sister Hammoleketh bare Ishod, and Abiezer, and Mahalah.
And*p the sons of Shemida were, Ahian, and Shechem, and Likhi, and Aniam.
And*p the sons of Ephraim; Shuthelah, and Bered his son, and Tahath his son, and Eladah his son, and Tahath his son,
And*p Zabad his son, and Shuthelah his son, and Ezer, and Elead, whom the men of Gath that were born in that land slew, because they came down to take away their cattle.
And*p Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brethren came to comfort him.
And*p when he went in to his wife, she conceived, and bare a son, and he called his name Beriah, because it went evil with his house.
(And*p his daughter was Sherah, who built Beth–horon the nether, and the upper, and Uzzen–sheerah.)
And*p Rephah was his son, also Resheph, and Telah his son, and Tahan his son,
Laadan*p his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
Non*p his son, Jehoshua his son.

And*p their possessions and habitations were, Beth–el and the towns thereof, and eastward Naaran, and westward Gezer, with the towns thereof; Shechem also and the towns thereof, unto Gaza and the towns thereof:
And*p by the borders of the children of Manasseh, Beth–shean and her towns, Taanach and her towns, Megiddo and her towns, Dor and her towns. In these dwelt the children of Joseph the son of Israel.
The*p sons of Asher; Imnah, and Ishuah, and Ishvi, and Beriah, and Serah their sister.
And*p the sons of Beriah; Heber, and Malchiel, who is the father of Birzavith.
And*p Heber begat Japhlet, and Shomer, and Hotham, and Shua their sister.
And*p the sons of Japhlet; Pasach, and Bimhal, and Ashvath. These are the children of Japhlet.
And*p the sons of Shamer; Ahi, and Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.
And*p the sons of his brother Helem; Zophah, and Imna, and Shelesh, and Amal.
The*p sons of Zophah; Suah, and Harnepher, and Shual, and Beri, and Imrah,
Bezer,*p and Hod, and Shamma, and Shilshah, and Ithran, and Beera.
And*p the sons of Jether; Jephunneh, and Pispah, and Ara.
And*p the sons of Ulla; Arah, and Haniel, and Rezia.

All*p these were the children of Asher, heads of their father's house, choice and mighty men of valour, chief of the princes. And the number throughout the genealogy of them that were apt to the war and to battle was twenty and six thousand men.
1 Chronicles 8
Now*p Benjamin begat Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, and Aharah the third,
Nohah*p the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
And*p the sons of Bela were, Addar, and Gera, and Abihud,
And*p Abishua, and Naaman, and Ahoah,
And*p Gera, and Shephuphan, and Huram.
And*p these are the sons of Ehud: these are the heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Geba, and they removed them to Manahath:
And*p Naaman, and Ahiah, and Gera, he removed them, and begat Uzza, and Ahihud.
And*p Shaharaim begat children in the country of Moab, after he had sent them away; Hushim and Baara were his wives.
And*p he begat of Hodesh his wife, Jobab, and Zibia, and Mesha, and Malcham,
And*p Jeuz, and Shachia, and Mirma. These were his sons, heads of the fathers.
And*p of Hushim he begat Abitub, and Elpaal.
The*p sons of Elpaal; Eber, and Misham, and Shamed, who built Ono, and Lod, with the towns thereof:
Beriah*p also, and Shema, who were heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who drove away the inhabitants of Gath:
And*p Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth,
And*p Zebadiah, and Arad, and Ader,
And*p Michael, and Ispah, and Joha, the sons of Beriah;
And*p Zebadiah, and Meshullam, and Hezeki, and Heber,
Ishmerai*p also, and Jezliah, and Jobab, the sons of Elpaal;
And*p Jakim, and Zichri, and Zabdi,
And*p Elienai, and Zilthai, and Eliel,
And*p Adaiah, and Beraiah, and Shimrath, the sons of Shimhi;
And*p Ishpan, and Heber, and Eliel,
And*p Abdon, and Zichri, and Hanan,
And*p Hananiah, and Elam, and Antothijah,
And*p Iphedeiah, and Penuel, the sons of Shashak;
And*p Shamsherai, and Shehariah, and Athaliah,
And*p Jaresiah, and Eliah, and Zichri, the sons of Jeroham.
These*p were heads of the fathers, by their generations, chief men. These dwelt in Jerusalem.
And*p at Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon; whose wife's name was Maachah:
And*p his firstborn son Abdon, and Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Nadab,
And*p Gedor, and Ahio, and Zacher.
And*p Mikloth begat Shimeah. And these also dwelt with their brethren in Jerusalem, over against them.
And*p Ner begat Kish, and Kish begat Saul, and Saul begat Jonathan, and Malchi–shua, and Abinadab, and Esh–baal.
And*p the son of Jonathan was Merib–baal; and Merib–baal begat Micah.
And*p the sons of Micah were, Pithon, and Melech, and Tarea, and Ahaz.
And*p Ahaz begat Jehoadah; and Jehoadah begat Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begat Moza,
And*p Moza begat Binea: Rapha was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son:
And*p Azel had six sons, whose names are these, Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
And*p the sons of Eshek his brother were, Ulam his firstborn, Jehush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
And*p the sons of Ulam were mighty men of valour, archers, and had many sons, and sons' sons, an hundred and fifty. All these are of the sons of Benjamin.
1 Chronicles 9
So*p all Israel were reckoned by genealogies; and, behold, they were written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah, who were carried away to Babylon for their transgression.
Now*p the first inhabitants that dwelt in their possessions in their cities were, the Israelites, the priests, Levites, and the Nethinims.
And*p in Jerusalem dwelt of the children of Judah, and of the children of Benjamin, and of the children of Ephraim, and Manasseh;
Uthai*p the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the children of Pharez the son of Judah.
And*p of the Shilonites; Asaiah the firstborn, and his sons.
And*p of the sons of Zerah; Jeuel, and their brethren, six hundred and ninety.
And*p of the sons of Benjamin; Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hasenuah,
And*p Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam the son of Shephathiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;
And*p their brethren, according to their generations, nine hundred and fifty and six. All these men were chief of the fathers in the house of their fathers.
And*p of the priests; Jedaiah, and Jehoiarib, and Jachin,
And*p Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of the house of God;
And*p Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasiai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;
And*p their brethren, heads of the house of their fathers, a thousand and seven hundred and threescore; very able men for the work of the service of the house of God.
And*p of the Levites; Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;
And*p Bakbakkar, Heresh, and Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph;
And*p Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, that dwelt in the villages of the Netophathites.
And*p the porters were, Shallum, and Akkub, and Talmon, and Ahiman, and their brethren: Shallum was the chief;
Who*p hitherto waited in the king's gate eastward: they were porters in the companies of the children of Levi.

And*p Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brethren, of the house of his father, the Korahites, were over the work of the service, keepers of the gates of the tabernacle: and their fathers, being over the host of the Lord,*s were keepers of the entry.
And*p Phinehas the son of Eleazar was the ruler over them in time past, and the Lord*s was with him.
And*p Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was porter of the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

All*p these which were chosen to be porters in the gates were two hundred and twelve. These were reckoned by their genealogy in their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer did ordain in their set office.
So*p they and their children had the oversight of the gates of the house of the Lord,*s namely, the house of the tabernacle, by wards.
In*p four quarters were the porters, toward the east, west, north, and south.
And*p their brethren, which were in their villages, were to come after seven days from time to time with them.
For*p these Levites, the four chief porters, were in their set office, and were over the chambers and treasuries of the house of God.
And*p they lodged round about the house of God, because the charge was upon them, and the opening thereof every morning pertained to them.
And*p certain of them had the charge of the ministering vessels, that they should bring them in and out by tale.
Some*p of them also were appointed to oversee the vessels, and all the instruments of the sanctuary, and the fine flour, and the wine, and the oil, and the frankincense, and the spices.
And*p some of the sons of the priests made the ointment of the spices.
And*p Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the set office over the things that were made in the pans.
And*p other of their brethren, of the sons of the Kohathites, were over the shewbread, to prepare it every sabbath.
And*p these are the singers, chief of the fathers of the Levites, who remaining in the chambers were free: for they were employed in that work day and night.
These*p chief fathers of the Levites were chief throughout their generations; these dwelt at Jerusalem.
And*p in Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon, Jehiel, whose wife's name was Maachah:
And*p his firstborn son Abdon, then Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Ner, and Nadab,
And*p Gedor, and Ahio, and Zechariah, and Mikloth.
And*p Mikloth begat Shimeam. And they also dwelt with their brethren at Jerusalem, over against their brethren.
And*p Ner begat Kish; and Kish begat Saul; and Saul begat Jonathan, and Malchi–shua, and Abinadab, and Esh–baal.
And*p the son of Jonathan was Merib–baal: and Merib–baal begat Micah.
And*p the sons of Micah were, Pithon, and Melech, and Tahrea, and Ahaz.
And*p Ahaz begat Jarah; and Jarah begat Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begat Moza;
And*p Moza begat Binea; and Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
And*p Azel had six sons, whose names are these, Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan: these were the sons of Azel.
1 Chronicles 10
Now*p the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain in mount Gilboa.
And*p the Philistines followed hard after Saul, and after his sons; and the Philistines slew Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchi–shua, the sons of Saul.
And*p the battle went sore against Saul, and the archers hit him, and he was wounded of the archers.

Then*p said Saul to his armourbearer, Draw thy sword, and thrust me through therewith; lest these uncircumcised come and abuse me. But his armourbearer would not; for he was sore afraid. So Saul took a sword, and fell upon it.
And*p when his armourbearer saw that Saul was dead, he fell likewise on the sword, and died.
So*p Saul died, and his three sons, and all his house died together.

And*p when all the men of Israel that were in the valley saw that they fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, then they forsook their cities, and fled: and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.
And*p it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his sons fallen in mount Gilboa.
And*p when they had stripped him, they took his head, and his armour, and sent into the land of the Philistines round about, to carry tidings unto their idols, and to the people.
And*p they put his armour in the house of their gods, and fastened his head in the temple of Dagon.
And*p when all Jabesh–gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,
They*p arose, all the valiant men, and took away the body of Saul, and the bodies of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.

So*p Saul died for his transgression which he committed against the Lord,*s even against the word of the Lord,*s which he kept not, and also for asking counsel of one that had a familiar spirit, to enquire of it;
And*p enquired not of the Lord:*s therefore he slew him, and turned the kingdom unto David the son of Jesse.
1 Chronicles 11
Then*p all Israel gathered themselves to David unto Hebron, saying, Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh.

And*p moreover in time past, even when Saul was king, thou wast he that leddest out and broughtest in Israel: and the Lord*s thy God said unto thee, Thou shalt feed my people Israel, and thou shalt be ruler over my people Israel.

Therefore*p came all the elders of Israel to the king to Hebron; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the Lord;*s and they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the Lord*s by Samuel.
And*p David and all Israel went to Jerusalem, which is Jebus; where the Jebusites were, the inhabitants of the land.
And*p the inhabitants of Jebus said to David, Thou shalt not come hither. Nevertheless David took the castle of Zion, which is the city of David.
And*p David said, Whosoever smiteth the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain. So Joab the son of Zeruiah went first up, and was chief.
And*p David dwelt in the castle; therefore they called it the city of David.
And*p he built the city round about, even from Millo round about: and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
So*p David waxed greater and greater: for the Lord*s of hosts was with him.

These*p also are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who strengthened themselves with him in his kingdom, and with all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of the Lord*s concerning Israel.
And*p this is the number of the mighty men whom David had; Jashobeam, an Hachmonite, the chief of the captains: he lifted up his spear against three hundred slain by him at one time.
And*p after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighties.
He*p was with David at Pas–dammim, and there the Philistines were gathered together to battle, where was a parcel of ground full of barley; and the people fled from before the Philistines.
And*p they set themselves in the midst of that parcel, and delivered it, and slew the Philistines; and the Lord*s saved them by a great deliverance.
Now*p three of the thirty captains went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the host of the Philistines encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
And*p David was then in the hold, and the Philistines' garrison was then at Beth–lehem.
And*p David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me drink of the water of the well of Beth–lehem, that is at the gate!

And*p the three brake through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth–lehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: but David would not drink of it, but poured it out to the Lord,*s

And*p said, My God forbid it me, that I should do this thing: shall I drink the blood of these men that have put their lives in jeopardy? for with the jeopardy of their lives they brought it. Therefore he would not drink it. These things did these three mightiest.
And*p Abishai the brother of Joab, he was chief of the three: for lifting up his spear against three hundred, he slew them, and had a name among the three.
Of*p the three, he was more honourable than the two; for he was their captain: howbeit he attained not to the first three.
Benaiah*p the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done many acts; he slew two lionlike men of Moab: also he went down and slew a lion in a pit in a snowy day.

And*p he slew an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high; and in the Egyptian's hand was a spear like a weaver's beam; and he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand, and slew him with his own spear.
These*p things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had the name among the three mighties.
Behold,*p he was honourable among the thirty, but attained not to the first three: and David set him over his guard.
Also*p the valiant men of the armies were, Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth–lehem,
Shammoth*p the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
Ira*p the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abi–ezer the Anathothite,
Sibbecai*p the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
Maharai*p the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
Ithai*p the son of Ribai of Gibeah, that pertained to the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
Hurai*p of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
Azmaveth*p the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
The*p sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shage the Hararite,
Ahiam*p the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,
Hepher*p the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
Hezro*p the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,
Joel*p the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Haggeri,
Zelek*p the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armourbearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,
Ira*p the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
Uriah*p the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,
Adina*p the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a captain of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,
Hanan*p the son of Maachah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite,
Uzzia*p the Ashterathite, Shama and Jehiel the sons of Hothan the Aroerite,
Jediael*p the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite,
Eliel*p the Mahavite, and Jeribai, and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,
Eliel,*p and Obed, and Jasiel the Mesobaite.
1 Chronicles 12
Now*p these are they that came to David to Ziklag, while he yet kept himself close because of Saul the son of Kish: and they were among the mighty men, helpers of the war.
They*p were armed with bows, and could use both the right hand and the left in hurling stones and shooting arrows out of a bow, even of Saul's brethren of Benjamin.
The*p chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; and Jeziel, and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; and Berachah, and Jehu the Anathothite,
And*p Ismaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty, and over the thirty; and Jeremiah, and Jahaziel, and Johanan, and Josabad the Gederathite,
Eluzai,*p and Jerimoth, and Bealiah, and Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite,
Elkanah,*p and Jesiah, and Azareel, and Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korhites,
And*p Joelah, and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.

And*p of the Gadites there separated themselves unto David into the hold to the wilderness men of might, and men of war fit for the battle, that could handle shield and buckler, whose faces were like the faces of lions, and were as swift as the roes upon the mountains;
Ezer*p the first, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
Mishmannah*p the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
Attai*p the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
Johanan*p the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
Jeremiah*p the tenth, Machbanai the eleventh.
These*p were of the sons of Gad, captains of the host: one of the least was over an hundred, and the greatest over a thousand.
These*p are they that went over Jordan in the first month, when it had overflown all his banks; and they put to flight all them of the valleys, both toward the east, and toward the west.
And*p there came of the children of Benjamin and Judah to the hold unto David.

And*p David went out to meet them, and answered and said unto them, If ye be come peaceably unto me to help me, mine heart shall be knit unto you: but if ye be come to betray me to mine enemies, seeing there is no wrong in mine hands, the God of our fathers look thereon, and rebuke it.

Then*p the spirit came upon Amasai, who was chief of the captains, and he said, Thine are we, David, and on thy side, thou son of Jesse: peace, peace be unto thee, and peace be to thine helpers; for thy God helpeth thee. Then David received them, and made them captains of the band.

And*p there fell some of Manasseh to David, when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle: but they helped them not: for the lords of the Philistines upon advisement sent him away, saying, He will fall to his master Saul to the jeopardy of our heads.
As*p he went to Ziklag, there fell to him of Manasseh, Adnah, and Jozabad, and Jediael, and Michael, and Jozabad, and Elihu, and Zilthai, captains of the thousands that were of Manasseh.
And*p they helped David against the band of the rovers: for they were all mighty men of valour, and were captains in the host.
For*p at that time day by day there came to David to help him, until it was a great host, like the host of God.
And*p these are the numbers of the bands that were ready armed to the war, and came to David to Hebron, to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the word of the Lord.*s
The*p children of Judah that bare shield and spear were six thousand and eight hundred, ready armed to the war.
Of*p the children of Simeon, mighty men of valour for the war, seven thousand and one hundred.
Of*p the children of Levi four thousand and six hundred.
And*p Jehoiada was the leader of the Aaronites, and with him were three thousand and seven hundred;
And*p Zadok, a young man mighty of valour, and of his father's house twenty and two captains.
And*p of the children of Benjamin, the kindred of Saul, three thousand: for hitherto the greatest part of them had kept the ward of the house of Saul.
And*p of the children of Ephraim twenty thousand and eight hundred, mighty men of valour, famous throughout the house of their fathers.
And*p of the half tribe of Manasseh eighteen thousand, which were expressed by name, to come and make David king.

And*p of the children of Issachar, which were men that had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do; the heads of them were two hundred; and all their brethren were at their commandment.
Of*p Zebulun, such as went forth to battle, expert in war, with all instruments of war, fifty thousand, which could keep rank: they were not of double heart.
And*p of Naphtali a thousand captains, and with them with shield and spear thirty and seven thousand.
And*p of the Danites expert in war twenty and eight thousand and six hundred.
And*p of Asher, such as went forth to battle, expert in war, forty thousand.
And*p on the other side of Jordan, of the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and of the half tribe of Manasseh, with all manner of instruments of war for the battle, an hundred and twenty thousand.
All*p these men of war, that could keep rank, came with a perfect heart to Hebron, to make David king over all Israel: and all the rest also of Israel were of one heart to make David king.
And*p there they were with David three days, eating and drinking: for their brethren had prepared for them.

Moreover*p they that were nigh them, even unto Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, brought bread on asses, and on camels, and on mules, and on oxen, and meat, meal, cakes of figs, and bunches of raisins, and wine, and oil, and oxen, and sheep abundantly: for there was joy in Israel.
1 Chronicles 13
And*p David consulted with the captains of thousands and hundreds, and with every leader.

And*p David said unto all the congregation of Israel, If it seem good unto you, and that it be of the Lord*s our God, let us send abroad unto our brethren every where, that are left in all the land of Israel, and with them also to the priests and Levites which are in their cities and suburbs, that they may gather themselves unto us:
And*p let us bring again the ark of our God to us: for we enquired not at it in the days of Saul.
And*p all the congregation said that they would do so: for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
So*p David gathered all Israel together, from Shihor of Egypt even unto the entering of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kirjath–jearim.

And*p David went up, and all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kirjath–jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up thence the ark of God the Lord,*s that dwelleth between the cherubims, whose name is called on it.
And*p they carried the ark of God in a new cart out of the house of Abinadab: and Uzza and Ahio drave the cart.
And*p David and all Israel played before God with all their might, and with singing, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with timbrels, and with cymbals, and with trumpets.
And*p when they came unto the threshingfloor of Chidon, Uzza put forth his hand to hold the ark; for the oxen stumbled.
And*p the anger of the Lord*s was kindled against Uzza, and he smote him, because he put his hand to the ark: and there he died before God.
And*p David was displeased, because the Lord*s had made a breach upon Uzza: wherefore that place is called Perez–uzza to this day.
And*p David was afraid of God that day, saying, How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?
So*p David brought not the ark home to himself to the city of David, but carried it aside into the house of Obed–edom the Gittite.
And*p the ark of God remained with the family of Obed–edom in his house three months. And the Lord*s blessed the house of Obed–edom, and all that he had.
1 Chronicles 14
Now*p Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and timber of cedars, with masons and carpenters, to build him an house.
And*p David perceived that the Lord*s had confirmed him king over Israel, for his kingdom was lifted up on high, because of his people Israel.
And*p David took more wives at Jerusalem: and David begat more sons and daughters.
Now*p these are the names of his children which he had in Jerusalem; Shammua, and Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon,
And*p Ibhar, and Elishua, and Elpalet,
And*p Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
And*p Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
And*p when the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David. And David heard of it, and went out against them.
And*p the Philistines came and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.
And*p David enquired of God, saying, Shall I go up against the Philistines? and wilt thou deliver them into mine hand? And the Lord*s said unto him, Go up; for I will deliver them into thine hand.

So*p they came up to Baal–perazim; and David smote them there. Then David said, God hath broken in upon mine enemies by mine hand like the breaking forth of waters: therefore they called the name of that place Baal–perazim.
And*p when they had left their gods there, David gave a commandment, and they were burned with fire.
And*p the Philistines yet again spread themselves abroad in the valley.
Therefore*p David enquired again of God; and God said unto him, Go not up after them; turn away from them, and come upon them over against the mulberry trees.

And*p it shall be, when thou shalt hear a sound of going in the tops of the mulberry trees, that then thou shalt go out to battle: for God is gone forth before thee to smite the host of the Philistines.
David*p therefore did as God commanded him: and they smote the host of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gezer.
And*p the fame of David went out into all lands; and the Lord*s brought the fear of him upon all nations.
1 Chronicles 15
And*p David made him houses in the city of David, and prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched for it a tent.
Then*p David said, None ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites: for them hath the Lord*s chosen to carry the ark of God, and to minister unto him for ever.
And*p David gathered all Israel together to Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the Lord*s unto his place, which he had prepared for it.
And*p David assembled the children of Aaron, and the Levites:
Of*p the sons of Kohath; Uriel the chief, and his brethren an hundred and twenty:
Of*p the sons of Merari; Asaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred and twenty:
Of*p the sons of Gershom; Joel the chief, and his brethren an hundred and thirty:
Of*p the sons of Elizaphan; Shemaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred:
Of*p the sons of Hebron; Eliel the chief, and his brethren fourscore:
Of*p the sons of Uzziel; Amminadab the chief, and his brethren an hundred and twelve.
And*p David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah, and Joel, Shemaiah, and Eliel, and Amminadab,

And*p said unto them, Ye are the chief of the fathers of the Levites: sanctify yourselves, both ye and your brethren, that ye may bring up the ark of the Lord*s God of Israel unto the place that I have prepared for it.
For*p because ye did it not at the first, the Lord*s our God made a breach upon us, for that we sought him not after the due order.
So*p the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the Lord*s God of Israel.
And*p the children of the Levites bare the ark of God upon their shoulders with the staves thereon, as Moses commanded according to the word of the Lord.*s
And*p David spake to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brethren to be the singers with instruments of musick, psalteries and harps and cymbals, sounding, by lifting up the voice with joy.
So*p the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari their brethren, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;

And*p with them their brethren of the second degree, Zechariah, Ben, and Jaaziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, Eliab, and Benaiah, and Maaseiah, and Mattithiah, and Elipheleh, and Mikneiah, and Obed–edom, and Jeiel, the porters.
So*p the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were appointed to sound with cymbals of brass;
And*p Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with psalteries on Alamoth;
And*p Mattithiah, and Elipheleh, and Mikneiah, and Obed–edom, and Jeiel, and Azaziah, with harps on the Sheminith to excel.
And*p Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was for song: he instructed about the song, because he was skilful.
And*p Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark.

And*p Shebaniah, and Jehoshaphat, and Nethaneel, and Amasai, and Zechariah, and Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, did blow with the trumpets before the ark of God: and Obed–edom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.
So*p David, and the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands, went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord*s out of the house of Obed–edom with joy.
And*p it came to pass, when God helped the Levites that bare the ark of the covenant of the Lord,*s that they offered seven bullocks and seven rams.

And*p David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, and all the Levites that bare the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah the master of the song with the singers: David also had upon him an ephod of linen.
Thus*p all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord*s with shouting, and with sound of the cornet, and with trumpets, and with cymbals, making a noise with psalteries and harps.

And*p it came to pass, as the ark of the covenant of the Lord*s came to the city of David, that Michal the daughter of Saul looking out at a window saw king David dancing and playing: and she despised him in her heart.
1 Chronicles 16
So*p they brought the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it: and they offered burnt sacrifices and peace offerings before God.
And*p when David had made an end of offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.*s
And*p he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a good piece of flesh, and a flagon of wine.
And*p he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of the Lord,*s and to record, and to thank and praise the Lord*s God of Israel:

Asaph*p the chief, and next to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obed–edom: and Jeiel with psalteries and with harps; but Asaph made a sound with cymbals;
Benaiah*p also and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
Then*p on that day David delivered first this psalm to thank the Lord*s into the hand of Asaph and his brethren.
Give*p thanks unto the Lord,*s call upon his name, make known his deeds among the people.
Sing*p unto him, sing psalms unto him, talk ye of all his wondrous works.
Glory*p ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.*s
Seek*p the Lord*s and his strength, seek his face continually.
Remember*p his marvellous works that he hath done, his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;
O*p ye seed of Israel his servant, ye children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
He*p is the Lord*s our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
Be*p ye mindful always of his covenant; the word which he commanded to a thousand generations;
Even*p of the covenant which he made with Abraham, and of his oath unto Isaac;
And*p hath confirmed the same to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
Saying,*p Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance;
When*p ye were but few, even a few, and strangers in it.
And*p when they went from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people;
He*p suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,
Saying,*p Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.
Sing*p unto the Lord,*s all the earth; shew forth from day to day his salvation.
Declare*p his glory among the heathen; his marvellous works among all nations.
For*p great is the Lord,*s and greatly to be praised: he also is to be feared above all gods.
For*p all the gods of the people are idols: but the Lord*s made the heavens.
Glory*p and honour are in his presence; strength and gladness are in his place.
Give*p unto the Lord,*s ye kindreds of the people, give unto the Lord*s glory and strength.
Give*p unto the Lord*s the glory due unto his name: bring an offering, and come before him: worship the Lord*s in the beauty of holiness.
Fear*p before him, all the earth: the world also shall be stable, that it be not moved.
Let*p the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice: and let men say among the nations, The Lord*s reigneth.
Let*p the sea roar, and the fulness thereof: let the fields rejoice, and all that is therein.
Then*p shall the trees of the wood sing out at the presence of the Lord,*s because he cometh to judge the earth.
O*p give thanks unto the Lord;*s for he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.
And*p say ye, Save us, O God of our salvation, and gather us together, and deliver us from the heathen, that we may give thanks to thy holy name, and glory in thy praise.
Blessed*p be the Lord*s God of Israel for ever and ever. And all the people said, Amen, and praised the Lord.*s
So*p he left there before the ark of the covenant of the Lord*s Asaph and his brethren, to minister before the ark continually, as every day's work required:
And*p Obed–edom with their brethren, threescore and eight; Obed–edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be porters:
And*p Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the Lord*s in the high place that was at Gibeon,

To*p offer burnt offerings unto the Lord*s upon the altar of the burnt offering continually morning and evening, and to do according to all that is written in the law of the Lord,*s which he commanded Israel;
And*p with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were expressed by name, to give thanks to the Lord,*s because his mercy endureth for ever;
And*p with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those that should make a sound, and with musical instruments of God. And the sons of Jeduthun were porters.
And*p all the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.
1 Chronicles 17
Now*p it came to pass, as David sat in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, Lo, I dwell in an house of cedars, but the ark of the covenant of the Lord*s remaineth under curtains.
Then*p Nathan said unto David, Do all that is in thine heart; for God is with thee.
And*p it came to pass the same night, that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
Go*p and tell David my servant, Thus saith the Lord,*s Thou shalt not build me an house to dwell in:
For*p I have not dwelt in an house since the day that I brought up Israel unto this day; but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacle to another.
Wheresoever*p I have walked with all Israel, spake I a word to any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people, saying, Why have ye not built me an house of cedars?

Now*p therefore thus shalt thou say unto my servant David, Thus saith the Lord*s of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote, even from following the sheep, that thou shouldest be ruler over my people Israel:
And*p I have been with thee whithersoever thou hast walked, and have cut off all thine enemies from before thee, and have made thee a name like the name of the great men that are in the earth.

Also*p I will ordain a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, and they shall dwell in their place, and shall be moved no more; neither shall the children of wickedness waste them any more, as at the beginning,
And*p since the time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. Moreover I will subdue all thine enemies. Furthermore I tell thee that the Lord*s will build thee an house.
And*p it shall come to pass, when thy days be expired that thou must go to be with thy fathers, that I will raise up thy seed after thee, which shall be of thy sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
He*p shall build me an house, and I will stablish his throne for ever.
I*p will be his father, and he shall be my son: and I will not take my mercy away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee:
But*p I will settle him in mine house and in my kingdom for ever: and his throne shall be established for evermore.
According*p to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David.
And*p David the king came and sat before the Lord,*s and said, Who am I, O Lord*s God, and what is mine house, that thou hast brought me hitherto?

And*p yet this was a small thing in thine eyes, O God; for thou hast also spoken of thy servant's house for a great while to come, and hast regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, O Lord*s God.
What*p can David speak more to thee for the honour of thy servant? for thou knowest thy servant.
O*p Lord,*s for thy servant's sake, and according to thine own heart, hast thou done all this greatness, in making known all these great things.
O*p Lord,*s there is none like thee, neither is there any God beside thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.

And*p what one nation in the earth is like thy people Israel, whom God went to redeem to be his own people, to make thee a name of greatness and terribleness, by driving out nations from before thy people, whom thou hast redeemed out of Egypt?
For*p thy people Israel didst thou make thine own people for ever; and thou, Lord,*s becamest their God.
Therefore*p now, Lord,*s let the thing that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant and concerning his house be established for ever, and do as thou hast said.

Let*p it even be established, that thy name may be magnified for ever, saying, The Lord*s of hosts is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel: and let the house of David thy servant be established before thee.
For*p thou, O my God, hast told thy servant that thou wilt build him an house: therefore thy servant hath found in his heart to pray before thee.
And*p now, Lord,*s thou art God, and hast promised this goodness unto thy servant:
Now*p therefore let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may be before thee for ever: for thou blessest, O Lord,*s and it shall be blessed for ever.
1 Chronicles 18
Now*p after this it came to pass, that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them, and took Gath and her towns out of the hand of the Philistines.
And*p he smote Moab; and the Moabites became David's servants, and brought gifts.
And*p David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah unto Hamath, as he went to stablish his dominion by the river Euphrates.
And*p David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: David also houghed all the chariot horses, but reserved of them an hundred chariots.
And*p when the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadarezer king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.
Then*p David put garrisons in Syria–damascus; and the Syrians became David's servants, and brought gifts. Thus the Lord*s preserved David whithersoever he went.
And*p David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadarezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
Likewise*p from Tibhath, and from Chun, cities of Hadarezer, brought David very much brass, wherewith Solomon made the brasen sea, and the pillars, and the vessels of brass.
Now*p when Tou king of Hamath heard how David had smitten all the host of Hadarezer king of Zobah;

He*p sent Hadoram his son to king David, to enquire of his welfare, and to congratulate him, because he had fought against Hadarezer, and smitten him; (for Hadarezer had war with Tou;) and with him all manner of vessels of gold and silver and brass.

Them*p also king David dedicated unto the Lord,*s with the silver and the gold that he brought from all these nations; from Edom, and from Moab, and from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
Moreover*p Abishai the son of Zeruiah slew of the Edomites in the valley of salt eighteen thousand.
And*p he put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became David's servants. Thus the Lord*s preserved David whithersoever he went.
So*p David reigned over all Israel, and executed judgment and justice among all his people.
And*p Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, recorder.
And*p Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Abimelech the son of Abiathar, were the priests; and Shavsha was scribe;
And*p Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief about the king.
1 Chronicles 19
Now*p it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.

And*p David said, I will shew kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father shewed kindness to me. And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.

But*p the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Thinkest thou that David doth honour thy father, that he hath sent comforters unto thee? are not his servants come unto thee for to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out the land?
Wherefore*p Hanun took David's servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the midst hard by their buttocks, and sent them away.

Then*p there went certain, and told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them: for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.

And*p when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Syria–maacah, and out of Zobah.

So*p they hired thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maacah and his people; who came and pitched before Medeba. And the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.
And*p when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.
And*p the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array before the gate of the city: and the kings that were come were by themselves in the field.
Now*p when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose out of all the choice of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.
And*p the rest of the people he delivered unto the hand of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in array against the children of Ammon.
And*p he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will help thee.
Be*p of good courage, and let us behave ourselves valiantly for our people, and for the cities of our God: and let the Lord*s do that which is good in his sight.
So*p Joab and the people that were with him drew nigh before the Syrians unto the battle; and they fled before him.
And*p when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.

And*p when the Syrians saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they sent messengers, and drew forth the Syrians that were beyond the river: and Shophach the captain of the host of Hadarezer went before them.

And*p it was told David; and he gathered all Israel, and passed over Jordan, and came upon them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
But*p the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew of the Syrians seven thousand men which fought in chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.

And*p when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with David, and became his servants: neither would the Syrians help the children of Ammon any more.
1 Chronicles 20

And*p it came to pass, that after the year was expired, at the time that kings go out to battle, Joab led forth the power of the army, and wasted the country of the children of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried at Jerusalem. And Joab smote Rabbah, and destroyed it.

And*p David took the crown of their king from off his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it; and it was set upon David's head: and he brought also exceeding much spoil out of the city.

And*p he brought out the people that were in it, and cut them with saws, and with harrows of iron, and with axes. Even so dealt David with all the cities of the children of Ammon. And David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
And*p it came to pass after this, that there arose war at Gezer with the Philistines; at which time Sibbecai the Hushathite slew Sippai, that was of the children of the giant: and they were subdued.
And*p there was war again with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair slew Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, whose spear staff was like a weaver's beam.
And*p yet again there was war at Gath, where was a man of great stature, whose fingers and toes were four and twenty, six on each hand, and six on each foot: and he also was the son of the giant.
But*p when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea David's brother slew him.
These*p were born unto the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.
1 Chronicles 21
And*p Satan stood up against Israel, and provoked David to number Israel.
And*p David said to Joab and to the rulers of the people, Go, number Israel from Beer–sheba even to Dan; and bring the number of them to me, that I may know it.

And*p Joab answered, The Lord*s make his people an hundred times so many more as they be: but, my lord the king, are they not all my lord's servants? why then doth my lord require this thing? why will he be a cause of trespass to Israel?
Nevertheless*p the king's word prevailed against Joab. Wherefore Joab departed, and went throughout all Israel, and came to Jerusalem.

And*p Joab gave the sum of the number of the people unto David. And all they of Israel were a thousand thousand and an hundred thousand men that drew sword: and Judah was four hundred threescore and ten thousand men that drew sword.
But*p Levi and Benjamin counted he not among them: for the king's word was abominable to Joab.
And*p God was displeased with this thing; therefore he smote Israel.
And*p David said unto God, I have sinned greatly, because I have done this thing: but now, I beseech thee, do away the iniquity of thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Gad, David's seer, saying,
Go*p and tell David, saying, Thus saith the Lord,*s I offer thee three things: choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.
So*p Gad came to David, and said unto him, Thus saith the Lord,*s Choose thee

Either*p three years' famine; or three months to be destroyed before thy foes, while that the sword of thine enemies overtaketh thee; or else three days the sword of the Lord,*s even the pestilence, in the land, and the angel of the Lord*s destroying throughout all the coasts of Israel. Now therefore advise thyself what word I shall bring again to him that sent me.
And*p David said unto Gad, I am in a great strait: let me fall now into the hand of the Lord;*s for very great are his mercies: but let me not fall into the hand of man.
So*p the Lord*s sent pestilence upon Israel: and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.

And*p God sent an angel unto Jerusalem to destroy it: and as he was destroying, the Lord*s beheld, and he repented him of the evil, and said to the angel that destroyed, It is enough, stay now thine hand. And the angel of the Lord*s stood by the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.

And*p David lifted up his eyes, and saw the angel of the Lord*s stand between the earth and the heaven, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders of Israel, who were clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.

And*p David said unto God, Is it not I that commanded the people to be numbered? even I it is that have sinned and done evil indeed; but as for these sheep, what have they done? let thine hand, I pray thee, O Lord*s my God, be on me, and on my father's house; but not on thy people, that they should be plagued.
