Then*p the angel of the Lord*s commanded Gad to say to David, that David should go up, and set up an altar unto the Lord*s in the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.
And*p David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spake in the name of the Lord.*s
And*p Ornan turned back, and saw the angel; and his four sons with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.
And*p as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of the threshingfloor, and bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.

Then*p David said to Ornan, Grant me the place of this threshingfloor, that I may build an altar therein unto the Lord:*s thou shalt grant it me for the full price: that the plague may be stayed from the people.

And*p Ornan said unto David, Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes: lo, I give thee the oxen also for burnt offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meat offering; I give it all.
And*p king David said to Ornan, Nay; but I will verily buy it for the full price: for I will not take that which is thine for the Lord,*s nor offer burnt offerings without cost.
So*p David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.

And*p David built there an altar unto the Lord,*s and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings, and called upon the Lord;*s and he answered him from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt offering.
And*p the Lord*s commanded the angel; and he put up his sword again into the sheath thereof.
At*p that time when David saw that the Lord*s had answered him in the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.
For*p the tabernacle of the Lord,*s which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of the burnt offering, were at that season in the high place at Gibeon.
But*p David could not go before it to enquire of God: for he was afraid because of the sword of the angel of the Lord.*s
1 Chronicles 22
Then*p David said, This is the house of the Lord*s God, and this is the altar of the burnt offering for Israel.
And*p David commanded to gather together the strangers that were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to hew wrought stones to build the house of God.
And*p David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates, and for the joinings; and brass in abundance without weight;
Also*p cedar trees in abundance: for the Zidonians and they of Tyre brought much cedar wood to David.

And*p David said, Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be builded for the Lord*s must be exceeding magnifical, of fame and of glory throughout all countries: I will therefore now make preparation for it. So David prepared abundantly before his death.
Then*p he called for Solomon his son, and charged him to build an house for the Lord*s God of Israel.
And*p David said to Solomon, My son, as for me, it was in my mind to build an house unto the name of the Lord*s my God:

But*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying, Thou hast shed blood abundantly, and hast made great wars: thou shalt not build an house unto my name, because thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in my sight.

Behold,*p a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies round about: for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness unto Israel in his days.
He*p shall build an house for my name; and he shall be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever.
Now,*p my son, the Lord*s be with thee; and prosper thou, and build the house of the Lord*s thy God, as he hath said of thee.
Only*p the Lord*s give thee wisdom and understanding, and give thee charge concerning Israel, that thou mayest keep the law of the Lord*s thy God.
Then*p shalt thou prosper, if thou takest heed to fulfil the statutes and judgments which the Lord*s charged Moses with concerning Israel: be strong, and of good courage; dread not, nor be dismayed.

Now,*p behold, in my trouble I have prepared for the house of the Lord*s an hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver; and of brass and iron without weight; for it is in abundance: timber also and stone have I prepared; and thou mayest add thereto.
Moreover*p there are workmen with thee in abundance, hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all manner of cunning men for every manner of work.
Of*p the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise therefore, and be doing, and the Lord*s be with thee.
David*p also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,

Is*p not the Lord*s your God with you? and hath he not given you rest on every side? for he hath given the inhabitants of the land into mine hand; and the land is subdued before the Lord,*s and before his people.

Now*p set your heart and your soul to seek the Lord*s your God; arise therefore, and build ye the sanctuary of the Lord*s God, to bring the ark of the covenant of the Lord,*s and the holy vessels of God, into the house that is to be built to the name of the Lord.*s
1 Chronicles 23
So*p when David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
And*p he gathered together all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
Now*p the Levites were numbered from the age of thirty years and upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty and eight thousand.
Of*p which, twenty and four thousand were to set forward the work of the house of the Lord;*s and six thousand were officers and judges:
Moreover*p four thousand were porters; and four thousand praised the Lord*s with the instruments which I made, said David, to praise therewith.
And*p David divided them into courses among the sons of Levi, namely, Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
Of*p the Gershonites were, Laadan, and Shimei.
The*p sons of Laadan; the chief was Jehiel, and Zetham, and Joel, three.
The*p sons of Shimei; Shelomith, and Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the chief of the fathers of Laadan.
And*p the sons of Shimei were, Jahath, Zina, and Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
And*p Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second: but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons; therefore they were in one reckoning, according to their father's house.
The*p sons of Kohath; Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.

The*p sons of Amram; Aaron and Moses: and Aaron was separated, that he should sanctify the most holy things, he and his sons for ever, to burn incense before the Lord,*s to minister unto him, and to bless in his name for ever.
Now*p concerning Moses the man of God, his sons were named of the tribe of Levi.
The*p sons of Moses were, Gershom, and Eliezer.
Of*p the sons of Gershom, Shebuel was the chief.
And*p the sons of Eliezer were, Rehabiah the chief. And Eliezer had none other sons; but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
Of*p the sons of Izhar; Shelomith the chief.
Of*p the sons of Hebron; Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
Of*p the sons of Uzziel; Michah the first, and Isshiah the second.
The*p sons of Merari; Mahli, and Mushi. The sons of Mahli; Eleazar, and Kish.
And*p Eleazar died, and had no sons, but daughters: and their brethren the sons of Kish took them.
The*p sons of Mushi; Mahli, and Eder, and Jeremoth, three.

These*p were the sons of Levi after the house of their fathers; even the chief of the fathers, as they were counted by number of names by their polls, that did the work for the service of the house of the Lord,*s from the age of twenty years and upward.
For*p David said, The Lord*s God of Israel hath given rest unto his people, that they may dwell in Jerusalem for ever:
And*p also unto the Levites; they shall no more carry the tabernacle, nor any vessels of it for the service thereof.
For*p by the last words of David the Levites were numbered from twenty years old and above:

Because*p their office was to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the Lord,*s in the courts, and in the chambers, and in the purifying of all holy things, and the work of the service of the house of God;

Both*p for the shewbread, and for the fine flour for meat offering, and for the unleavened cakes, and for that which is baked in the pan, and for that which is fried, and for all manner of measure and size;
And*p to stand every morning to thank and praise the Lord,*s and likewise at even;
And*p to offer all burnt sacrifices unto the Lord*s in the sabbaths, in the new moons, and on the set feasts, by number, according to the order commanded unto them, continually before the Lord:*s

And*p that they should keep the charge of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the charge of the holy place, and the charge of the sons of Aaron their brethren, in the service of the house of the Lord.*s
1 Chronicles 24
Now*p these are the divisions of the sons of Aaron. The sons of Aaron; Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
But*p Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children: therefore Eleazar and Ithamar executed the priest's office.
And*p David distributed them, both Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, according to their offices in their service.

And*p there were more chief men found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar; and thus were they divided. Among the sons of Eleazar there were sixteen chief men of the house of their fathers, and eight among the sons of Ithamar according to the house of their fathers.
Thus*p were they divided by lot, one sort with another; for the governors of the sanctuary, and governors of the house of God, were of the sons of Eleazar, and of the sons of Ithamar.

And*p Shemaiah the son of Nethaneel the scribe, one of the Levites, wrote them before the king, and the princes, and Zadok the priest, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and before the chief of the fathers of the priests and Levites: one principal household being taken for Eleazar, and one taken for Ithamar.
Now*p the first lot came forth to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
The*p third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
The*p fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
The*p seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
The*p ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
The*p eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
The*p thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
The*p fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
The*p seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Aphses,
The*p nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezekel,
The*p one and twentieth to Jachin, the two and twentieth to Gamul,
The*p three and twentieth to Delaiah, the four and twentieth to Maaziah.
These*p were the orderings of them in their service to come into the house of the Lord,*s according to their manner, under Aaron their father, as the Lord*s God of Israel had commanded him.
And*p the rest of the sons of Levi were these: Of the sons of Amram; Shubael: of the sons of Shubael; Jehdeiah.
Concerning*p Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, the first was Isshiah.
Of*p the Izharites; Shelomoth: of the sons of Shelomoth; Jahath.
And*p the sons of Hebron; Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
Of*p the sons of Uzziel; Michah: of the sons of Michah; Shamir.
The*p brother of Michah was Isshiah: of the sons of Isshiah; Zechariah.
The*p sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi: the sons of Jaaziah; Beno.
The*p sons of Merari by Jaaziah; Beno, and Shoham, and Zaccur, and Ibri.
Of*p Mahli came Eleazar, who had no sons.
Concerning*p Kish: the son of Kish was Jerahmeel.
The*p sons also of Mushi; Mahli, and Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites after the house of their fathers.

These*p likewise cast lots over against their brethren the sons of Aaron in the presence of David the king, and Zadok, and Ahimelech, and the chief of the fathers of the priests and Levites, even the principal fathers over against their younger brethren.
1 Chronicles 25

Moreover*p David and the captains of the host separated to the service of the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who should prophesy with harps, with psalteries, and with cymbals: and the number of the workmen according to their service was:
Of*p the sons of Asaph; Zaccur, and Joseph, and Nethaniah, and Asarelah, the sons of Asaph under the hands of Asaph, which prophesied according to the order of the king.

Of*p Jeduthun: the sons of Jeduthun; Gedaliah, and Zeri, and Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with a harp, to give thanks and to praise the Lord.*s
Of*p Heman: the sons of Heman; Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamti–ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth:
All*p these were the sons of Heman the king's seer in the words of God, to lift up the horn. And God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.

All*p these were under the hands of their father for song in the house of the Lord,*s with cymbals, psalteries, and harps, for the service of the house of God, according to the king's order to Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman.
So*p the number of them, with their brethren that were instructed in the songs of the Lord,*s even all that were cunning, was two hundred fourscore and eight.
And*p they cast lots, ward against ward, as well the small as the great, the teacher as the scholar.
Now*p the first lot came forth for Asaph to Joseph: the second to Gedaliah, who with his brethren and sons were twelve:
The*p third to Zaccur, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p fourth to Izri, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p fifth to Nethaniah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p sixth to Bukkiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p seventh to Jesharelah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p eighth to Jeshaiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p ninth to Mattaniah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p tenth to Shimei, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p eleventh to Azareel, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p twelfth to Hashabiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p thirteenth to Shubael, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p fourteenth to Mattithiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p fifteenth to Jeremoth, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p sixteenth to Hananiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p seventeenth to Joshbekashah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p eighteenth to Hanani, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p nineteenth to Mallothi, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p twentieth to Eliathah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p one and twentieth to Hothir, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p two and twentieth to Giddalti, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p three and twentieth to Mahazioth, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
The*p four and twentieth to Romamti–ezer, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve.
1 Chronicles 26
Concerning*p the divisions of the porters: Of the Korhites was Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
And*p the sons of Meshelemiah were, Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
Elam*p the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Elioenai the seventh.
Moreover*p the sons of Obed–edom were, Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, and Sacar the fourth, and Nethaneel the fifth,
Ammiel*p the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eighth: for God blessed him.
Also*p unto Shemaiah his son were sons born, that ruled throughout the house of their father: for they were mighty men of valour.
The*p sons of Shemaiah; Othni, and Rephael, and Obed, Elzabad, whose brethren were strong men, Elihu, and Semachiah.
All*p these of the sons of Obed–edom: they and their sons and their brethren, able men for strength for the service, were threescore and two of Obed–edom.
And*p Meshelemiah had sons and brethren, strong men, eighteen.
Also*p Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons; Simri the chief, (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him the chief;)
Hilkiah*p the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.
Among*p these were the divisions of the porters, even among the chief men, having wards one against another, to minister in the house of the Lord.*s
And*p they cast lots, as well the small as the great, according to the house of their fathers, for every gate.
And*p the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son, a wise counsellor, they cast lots; and his lot came out northward.
To*p Obed–edom southward; and to his sons the house of Asuppim.
To*p Shuppim and Hosah the lot came forth westward, with the gate Shallecheth, by the causeway of the going up, ward against ward.
Eastward*p were six Levites, northward four a day, southward four a day, and toward Asuppim two and two.
At*p Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at Parbar.
These*p are the divisions of the porters among the sons of Kore, and among the sons of Merari.
And*p of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God, and over the treasures of the dedicated things.
As*p concerning the sons of Laadan; the sons of the Gershonite Laadan, chief fathers, even of Laadan the Gershonite, were Jehieli.
The*p sons of Jehieli; Zetham, and Joel his brother, which were over the treasures of the house of the Lord.*s
Of*p the Amramites, and the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:
And*p Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler of the treasures.
And*p his brethren by Eliezer; Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.

Which*p Shelomith and his brethren were over all the treasures of the dedicated things, which David the king, and the chief fathers, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the host, had dedicated.
Out*p of the spoils won in battles did they dedicate to maintain the house of the Lord.*s

And*p all that Samuel the seer, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah, had dedicated; and whosoever had dedicated any thing, it was under the hand of Shelomith, and of his brethren.
Of*p the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were for the outward business over Israel, for officers and judges.

And*p of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, men of valour, a thousand and seven hundred, were officers among them of Israel on this side Jordan westward in all the business of the Lord,*s and in the service of the king.

Among*p the Hebronites was Jeriah the chief, even among the Hebronites, according to the generations of his fathers. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty men of valour at Jazer of Gilead.

And*p his brethren, men of valour, were two thousand and seven hundred chief fathers, whom king David made rulers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, for every matter pertaining to God, and affairs of the king.
1 Chronicles 27

Now*p the children of Israel after their number, to wit, the chief fathers and captains of thousands and hundreds, and their officers that served the king in any matter of the courses, which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, of every course were twenty and four thousand.
Over*p the first course for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
Of*p the children of Perez was the chief of all the captains of the host for the first month.
And*p over the course of the second month was Dodai an Ahohite, and of his course was Mikloth also the ruler: in his course likewise were twenty and four thousand.
The*p third captain of the host for the third month was Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, a chief priest: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
This*p is that Benaiah, who was mighty among the thirty, and above the thirty: and in his course was Ammizabad his son.
The*p fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
The*p fifth captain for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
The*p sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
The*p seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
The*p eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zarhites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
The*p ninth captain for the ninth month was Abi–ezer the Anathothite, of the Benjamites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
The*p tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zarhites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
The*p eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
The*p twelfth captain for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
Furthermore*p over the tribes of Israel: the ruler of the Reubenites was Eliezer the son of Zichri: of the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maachah:
Of*p the Levites, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel: of the Aaronites, Zadok:
Of*p Judah, Elihu, one of the brethren of David: of Issachar, Omri the son of Michael:
Of*p Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah: of Naphtali, Jerimoth the son of Azriel:
Of*p the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah: of the half tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah:
Of*p the half tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah: of Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner:
Of*p Dan, Azareel the son of Jeroham. These were the princes of the tribes of Israel.
But*p David took not the number of them from twenty years old and under: because the Lord*s had said he would increase Israel like to the stars of the heavens.
Joab*p the son of Zeruiah began to number, but he finished not, because there fell wrath for it against Israel; neither was the number put in the account of the chronicles of king David.
And*p over the king's treasures was Azmaveth the son of Adiel: and over the storehouses in the fields, in the cities, and in the villages, and in the castles, was Jonathan the son of Uzziah:
And*p over them that did the work of the field for tillage of the ground was Ezri the son of Chelub:
And*p over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite: over the increase of the vineyards for the wine cellars was Zabdi the Shiphmite:
And*p over the olive trees and the sycomore trees that were in the low plains was Baal–hanan the Gederite: and over the cellars of oil was Joash:
And*p over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite: and over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai:
Over*p the camels also was Obil the Ishmaelite: and over the asses was Jehdeiah the Meronothite:
And*p over the flocks was Jaziz the Hagarite. All these were the rulers of the substance which was king David's.
Also*p Jonathan David's uncle was a counsellor, a wise man, and a scribe: and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king's sons:
And*p Ahithophel was the king's counsellor: and Hushai the Archite was the king's companion:
And*p after Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar: and the general of the king's army was Joab.
1 Chronicles 28

And*p David assembled all the princes of Israel, the princes of the tribes, and the captains of the companies that ministered to the king by course, and the captains over the thousands, and captains over the hundreds, and the stewards over all the substance and possession of the king, and of his sons, with the officers, and with the mighty men, and with all the valiant men, unto Jerusalem.

Then*p David the king stood up upon his feet, and said, Hear me, my brethren, and my people: As for me, I had in mine heart to build an house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the Lord,*s and for the footstool of our God, and had made ready for the building:
But*p God said unto me, Thou shalt not build an house for my name, because thou hast been a man of war, and hast shed blood.

Howbeit*p the Lord*s God of Israel chose me before all the house of my father to be king over Israel for ever: for he hath chosen Judah to be the ruler; and of the house of Judah, the house of my father; and among the sons of my father he liked me to make me king over all Israel:
And*p of all my sons, (for the Lord*s hath given me many sons,) he hath chosen Solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the Lord*s over Israel.
And*p he said unto me, Solomon thy son, he shall build my house and my courts: for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.
Moreover*p I will establish his kingdom for ever, if he be constant to do my commandments and my judgments, as at this day.

Now*p therefore in the sight of all Israel the congregation of the Lord,*s and in the audience of our God, keep and seek for all the commandments of the Lord*s your God: that ye may possess this good land, and leave it for an inheritance for your children after you for ever.

And*p thou, Solomon my son, know thou the God of thy father, and serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind: for the Lord*s searcheth all hearts, and understandeth all the imaginations of the thoughts: if thou seek him, he will be found of thee; but if thou forsake him, he will cast thee off for ever.
Take*p heed now; for the Lord*s hath chosen thee to build an house for the sanctuary: be strong, and do it.

Then*p David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch, and of the houses thereof, and of the treasuries thereof, and of the upper chambers thereof, and of the inner parlours thereof, and of the place of the mercy seat,

And*p the pattern of all that he had by the spirit, of the courts of the house of the Lord,*s and of all the chambers round about, of the treasuries of the house of God, and of the treasuries of the dedicated things:
Also*p for the courses of the priests and the Levites, and for all the work of the service of the house of the Lord,*s and for all the vessels of service in the house of the Lord.*s
He*p gave of gold by weight for things of gold, for all instruments of all manner of service; silver also for all instruments of silver by weight, for all instruments of every kind of service:

Even*p the weight for the candlesticks of gold, and for their lamps of gold, by weight for every candlestick, and for the lamps thereof: and for the candlesticks of silver by weight, both for the candlestick, and also for the lamps thereof, according to the use of every candlestick.
And*p by weight he gave gold for the tables of shewbread, for every table; and likewise silver for the tables of silver:
Also*p pure gold for the fleshhooks, and the bowls, and the cups: and for the golden basins he gave gold by weight for every basin; and likewise silver by weight for every basin of silver:
And*p for the altar of incense refined gold by weight; and gold for the pattern of the chariot of the cherubims, that spread out their wings, and covered the ark of the covenant of the Lord.*s
All*p this, said David, the Lord*s made me understand in writing by his hand upon me, even all the works of this pattern.

And*p David said to Solomon his son, Be strong and of good courage, and do it: fear not, nor be dismayed: for the Lord*s God, even my God, will be with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee, until thou hast finished all the work for the service of the house of the Lord.*s

And,*p behold, the courses of the priests and the Levites, even they shall be with thee for all the service of the house of God: and there shall be with thee for all manner of workmanship every willing skilful man, for any manner of service: also the princes and all the people will be wholly at thy commandment.
1 Chronicles 29

Furthermore*p David the king said unto all the congregation, Solomon my son, whom alone God hath chosen, is yet young and tender, and the work is great: for the palace is not for man, but for the Lord*s God.

Now*p I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for things to be made of gold, and the silver for things of silver, and the brass for things of brass, the iron for things of iron, and wood for things of wood; onyx stones, and stones to be set, glistering stones, and of divers colours, and all manner of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.

Moreover,*p because I have set my affection to the house of my God, I have of mine own proper good, of gold and silver, which I have given to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house,
Even*p three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, to overlay the walls of the houses withal:

The*p gold for things of gold, and the silver for things of silver, and for all manner of work to be made by the hands of artificers. And who then is willing to consecrate his service this day unto the Lord?*s
Then*p the chief of the fathers and princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers of the king's work, offered willingly,

And*p gave for the service of the house of God of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand drams, and of silver ten thousand talents, and of brass eighteen thousand talents, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
And*p they with whom precious stones were found gave them to the treasure of the house of the Lord,*s by the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
Then*p the people rejoiced, for that they offered willingly, because with perfect heart they offered willingly to the Lord:*s and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.
Wherefore*p David blessed the Lord*s before all the congregation: and David said, Blessed be thou, Lord*s God of Israel our father, for ever and ever.

Thine,*p O Lord,*s is the greatness, and the power, and the glory, and the victory, and the majesty: for all that is in the heaven and in the earth is thine; thine is the kingdom, O Lord,*s and thou art exalted as head above all.
Both*p riches and honour come of thee, and thou reignest over all; and in thine hand is power and might; and in thine hand it is to make great, and to give strength unto all.
Now*p therefore, our God, we thank thee, and praise thy glorious name.
But*p who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly after this sort? for all things come of thee, and of thine own have we given thee.
For*p we are strangers before thee, and sojourners, as were all our fathers: our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is none abiding.
O*p Lord*s our God, all this store that we have prepared to build thee an house for thine holy name cometh of thine hand, and is all thine own.

I*p know also, my God, that thou triest the heart, and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of mine heart I have willingly offered all these things: and now have I seen with joy thy people, which are present here, to offer willingly unto thee.
O*p Lord*s God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this for ever in the imagination of the thoughts of the heart of thy people, and prepare their heart unto thee:
And*p give unto Solomon my son a perfect heart, to keep thy commandments, thy testimonies, and thy statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for the which I have made provision.

And*p David said to all the congregation, Now bless the Lord*s your God. And all the congregation blessed the Lord*s God of their fathers, and bowed down their heads, and worshipped the Lord,*s and the king.

And*p they sacrificed sacrifices unto the Lord,*s and offered burnt offerings unto the Lord,*s on the morrow after that day, even a thousand bullocks, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel:

And*p did eat and drink before the Lord*s on that day with great gladness. And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him unto the Lord*s to be the chief governor, and Zadok to be priest.
Then*p Solomon sat on the throne of the Lord*s as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.
And*p all the princes, and the mighty men, and all the sons likewise of king David, submitted themselves unto Solomon the king.
And*p the Lord*s magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
Thus*p David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
And*p the time that he reigned over Israel was forty years; seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem.
And*p he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honour: and Solomon his son reigned in his stead.
Now*p the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of Samuel the seer, and in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer,
With*p all his reign and his might, and the times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all the kingdoms of the countries.
